results.title: UX/UI Lead
results.description:
Spacewell is looking for a hands-on and experienced UX/UI Lead for our local offices in Eindhoven or Wilrijk. You will define, implement and execute our UX/UI strategy. You will do this working closely with product management, development, commercial colleagues and our (potential) customers. Together with our Product Leadership you will act as a change agent in our transformation in becoming a full product driven company with a UX-first approach. You area true motivator and are able to get our teams excited as well! Are we speaking about you? Reach out!

A day on the job

  • 8.45 AM: You arrive at the office and open your mailbox. Right away, you have a Teams call with two of your colleagues from India. During this call you make sure they are up to date with the newest information about the UX/UI strategy.
  • 10.00 AM: Afterwards, you make yourself ready to give a short training to the (junior) UX/UI Designers with tips and tricks.
  • 10.45 AM: Because you are overall responsible for the product's UX, you play an important role in our product discovery processes, you meet up with your colleagues from product management to discuss the latest requirements
  • 11 AM: Time to fill up your cup of coffee!
  • 11.30 AM: You work on a training for our product managers/owners, developers and designers for using different methods, tools and Figma.
  • Noon: Lunch time!
  • 1 PM: You are also responsible to guide our product teams incorporating UX within their way of working.
  • 14.30 PM: You start with working out a new UX/UI strategy to implement.
  • 4 PM: You work on a set of high-fidelity mockups for the user stories assigned to you. Once the framework is clear, you assign the work to one of the team members.

What about the team?

As a UX/UI Lead you get to be a part of a dynamic and warm team of international direct colleagues. They understand the challenges that come with the job, and they are there to cheer you on when needed. Besides that, your colleagues all have a different background and diverse reference frameworks. This allows you to learn a lot on the job, both in terms of hard and soft skills. Depending on your evolution, expectations and what energizes you, a career path can be developed to measure.

Could this be you?

  • You have at least 3 years of experience working as a UX/UI Designer in product organizations.
  • You have university grade education (Bachelor or Master) preferably in Design.
  • You speak English fluently.
  • You are experienced with setting up an UX/UI strategy from scratch, design thinking and tools like validation patterns, Figma etc.
  • Working in an agile environment and using Scrum is not new for you.
  • You want to grow and learn within your expertise field.
  • You can bring your innovative vision to other people and have a sense of ownership.
  • You have the capacity to guide people and merge several products into one new product portfolio.

The challenges we see in this role

  • Spacewell is a company in full transition. At times this results in organized chaos. However, we stand together as a team to make sense of what's going on and to find meaning in each situation.
  • You're willing to learn, as you will carry out a diverse range of tasks for multiple regions. By linking different pieces of information together, you're easily able to get an idea of the bigger picture and to put things into perspective.
  • You're not afraid to speak up in case you have questions. You have a sense of responsibility and ownership, so that you know when to escalate (potential) issues, when to treat information in a confidential way.

How do we make this a win-win?

  • You get to be a part of a quick, innovative, dynamic and warm team of colleagues with different backgrounds and reference frameworks.
  • Your colleagues understand your challenges,¬† will help you along the way and appreciate your hard work.
  • You really get the chance to make a difference and to grow together with your colleagues. Such as, for example, our own Spacewell Academy and following LinkedIn Trainings.
  • Next to the flexible work hours and remote working possibilities, you will get a salary and fringe benefits in line with your experience.

What would next steps look like?

  1. You reach out to our recruitment team to send in your CV or to ask some further questions.
  2. You will be invited for a digital cup of coffee.
  3. Depending on locations and schedules, you will meet up with your future colleagues at our offices or virtually.

¬†

  • An experienced team who will fight beside you in the trenches to accomplish your goals

results.title: Director, Sales
results.description:
Sora is seeking a Director of Sales to coach our Sales team and build out/hone our sales processes, team, and culture.

¬†

About Sora

Sora‚Äôs mission is to empower people-focused teams to create exceptional employee experiences. These teams should be spending time with people, but unfortunately all facets of People teams are bogged down by managing processes instead of helping people. That‚Äôs where Sora comes in: we‚Äôre building a product that streamlines the tedious and repetitive work People teams do every day, from sending emails to assigning onboarding tasks to a new hire‚Äôs manager to syncing data across anywhere from 3 to 20 tools in a customer‚Äôs HR stack.

We‚Äôre a pure startup, with all the excitement that carries as a foundational member, but with more thoughtfulness than the typical early-stage company. We‚Äôre committed to our values and we take our mission seriously. Employee experience is in our DNA ‚Äî we invest in processes that are inclusive and fair, and we invest in our long-term mental, physical, and emotional health.

Sora was founded in late 2018 and launched in 2020. We‚Äôve fundraised from some of the best investors in the world and prioritize keeping a diverse group of investors and advisors.

Sora is committed to being a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age, physical disability, or length of time spent unemployed.

¬†

About the team

Our Sales team is full of good listeners and problem solvers. We‚Äôre lucky to work with and sell to empathetic, thoughtful people that are bought into our mission and committed to making a difference for employees at their companies. We sell by building relationships with great people and being genuine about how we can solve real problems for them.

¬†

We get to work closely with every single team at Sora to inform our product roadmap, ensure a smooth transition from sales to customer onboarding, help marketing with messaging that resonates with customers, and more.

¬†

We live all over the country and (outside of COVID) love to get together for board games, surfing, cooking, Mario Kart, and more :)

¬†

About the role

Sora has lots of early signs of product/market fit (e.g., we have amazing logos that rave about us and have produced some great case studies), and we have a huge opportunity to solidify our place in the HR tech market and grow exponentially from here.

¬†

To do this, you‚Äôll work with our CEO (our Head of Sales) to own the entire sales funnel, working to meet our goals by optimizing and finding repeatability in all parts of the sales process. You‚Äôll create and iterate on a sales process that is consistent and scalable, from prospecting to closing. You‚Äôll manage our existing team of two BDRs, one AE, and one Sales Engineer ‚Äî coaching and motivating them to success. You‚Äôll own sales forecasting, and ensure that the Sales team and the rest of the organization has access to our Sales metrics (defined and monitored by you) and understands how we‚Äôre tracking toward our goals. And as we‚Äôre ready to scale, you‚Äôll get to recruit and ramp a team full of empathetic, relationship-building, passionate salespeople.

¬†

You‚Äôll learn the ins and outs of our product and speak to customers so you can keep a pulse on our process and suggest improvements. And you‚Äôll interface with every department at Sora:¬†

  • You‚Äôll work with Marketing to work on messaging, lead qualification, targeting optimization, etc.¬†

  • You‚Äôll work with Customer Success to ensure smooth customer onboarding handoffs and make sure customers are set up for success from the beginning.¬†

  • You‚Äôll be proactive and communicative about all prospective customer needs, working closely with the Product team, so we can be constantly evaluating and improving our product/market fit.

¬†

You‚Äôll be the #1 advocate for Sora externally and steer the revenue ship to our success!

¬†

Behaviors we‚Äôre looking for

  • Owning outbound strategies to increase our top of funnel

  • Excellent management skills, including a ton of coaching and delivering candid and helpful feedback

  • Willingness to get your hands dirty: joining calls, understanding the product and our value proposition inside and out, reading contracts closely, and showing the team what it means to work smart

  • Introducing rigor into our processes and thinking about how we can iterate (first with lowest hanging fruit then anything else we can) to increase our conversion rates at every step and create a repeatable process

    ¬†

Relevant experience

  • 2+ years sales management experience

  • Direct SaaS closing experience

  • Experience with a wide range of ACVs ($10K-100K+)

  • Experience using, designing, and generating reporting through Salesforce

  • Proven track record of meeting and/or exceeding revenue quotas

  • Experience at early and middle stage startups

¬†

Benefits

  • Comprehensive health coverage ($0 deductible PPO plans): Sora covers 99% of individual monthly premiums for all employees, and 50% of dependent monthly premiums.

  • 401(k) with 3% direct company contribution: Sora deposits 3% of an employee's annual salary into their 401k, regardless of whether the employee is making individual contributions or not (so, essentially this is free money!).

  • Remote-first culture: A flexible work environment enabling our people to to do their best work.

  • Unlimited paid time off: We highly encourage at least 4-6 weeks.

  • $300/month Flexible Remote Work Stipend: These funds can be used towards a variety of remote work expenses.

  • Commuter benefits: To use if you're commuting to/from a co-working space.

  • Parental leave: 16 weeks of fully paid parental leave to all parents (regardless of family formation) with the option to extend 1 additional month at reduced pay.

  • In-person co-working weeks and retreats: 3 times a year we offer the opportunity for everyone to get together in-person in a different city in the US. Most recently, we brought folks to Austin for our annual retreat!

  • Ginger or Headspace: Anyone enrolled in Sora's health insurance should have access to a choice of either Ginger OR Headspace through Blue Shield.

  • Maven: Anyone enrolled in Sora's health insurance plans through Blue Shield should have access to Maven, an app that offers comprehensive care for everyone planning, starting, and raising a family.

  • Monthly stipend for coffee chats: We keep you connected with your co-workers by facilitating random pairings and encouraging you to meet (remotely ) for coffee, lunch, or donuts.

    ¬†

Ready to apply?

If you share our values and feel this role could be for you, we‚Äôd love to review your application! We promise we do take the time and care to review every application we receive. However, as much as we wish we could interview everyone who submits an application, we cannot guarantee an interview or feedback due to the volume of applications we are receiving today. We are rooting for you, and hope you do consider applying.

Note: You'll need valid U.S. work authorization to join us.¬†

Please note that a background check and employment verification will be required for this position. We may obtain one or more background screening reports about you, solely for employment purposes.
